newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Uzbekistan, Italy to boost cooperation - agency.
newsitem.headline: Uzbekistan, Italy to boost cooperation - agency.

text.p: The presidents of Uzbekistan and Italy signed on Saturday a series of agreements aimed at boosting economic cooperation between the two countries.
"We would like to see Italy as our permanent and reliable partner," Russia's Interfax news agency quoted Uzbek President Islam Karimov as telling a news conference in his capital Tashkent.

Karimov, who called Italian President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro's visit to his country "an important historic landmark", signed agreements on economic cooperation and in science, culture, education and tourism.

Scalfaro's delegation, which arrived to the Central Asian former Soviet republic on Friday evening, comprised around 50 people including businessmen eyeing investment opportunities in the resource-rich country of 23 million.

Uzbekistan's official Narodnoye Slovo daily said on Friday that foreign trade between the two countries rose last year to $142 million from $45 million in 1993. Its said around 40 Uzbek-Italian joint ventures are functioning in Uzbekistan.
Scalfaro is leaving Uzbekistan on Sunday for neighboring Kazakhstan.
